definition: to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: You don’t have to give up anything to become wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要为发家致富放弃什么。

sentences.english: Capitalists use laborers' surplus value to make a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 资本家利用劳工的剩余价值发家致富。

sentences.english: Cumming was wealthy in his own right .
sentences.chinese: 卡明是凭自己的本事发家致富的。

sentences.english: Rioux real rich in Africa, is currently the hao millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 丁原在非洲真正的发家了，目前是豪富翁。

sentences.english: He accumulated his possessions at the cost of losing friendship.
sentences.chinese: 他以失去友谊为代价发家。

sentences.english: For years the directors have been fattening on the efforts of the workers.
sentences.chinese: 多年来，厂长们一直靠工人们的劳动成果而发家致富。

sentences.english: Spring Festival couplets content often in the hair house amass and auspicious festive primarily.
sentences.chinese: 春联的内容常以发家致富和吉祥喜庆为主。

sentences.english: He later went on to build his wealth through real-estate investments and luxury goods.
sentences.chinese: 之后，他通过投资房地产和奢侈品行业而发家致富。

sentences.english: 'Hardly anything in the tech industry went from rags to riches overnight,' he explains.
sentences.chinese: 他解释道，科技行业没有什么会在一夜间发家致富的。

sentences.english: The survey finds that interviewers the most strongly suspect how the men get rich .
sentences.chinese: 调查发现，受访者对富人的发家方式最为质疑。

sentences.english: Kroenke has made his fortune from property and building shopping malls.
sentences.chinese: 科伦克是从房地产和建设商场方面发家的。

definition: to make one's mark/to go up in the world/to make one's fortune
to start out by/to grow an enterprise beginning with/to begin one's career by
the first pot of gold/the initial profits from an economic endeavour
to build up from nothing/to start from scratch
to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
